author: IGN
description:
The Battlefield 6 Beta is here and in full swing across two weekends in August! There have been a number of changes to the Battlefield formula over the years, and BF6 brings some things back that fans are used to, as well as some brand-new additions. After playing all through the first weekend, we’re here ahead of the second weekend to give you a quick rundown of the core experience as well as some tips to help you win matches and earn rewards for the full game during the Battlefield 6 Beta.

00:00 - Intro
00:27 - BF6 Open Beta Weekend Dates and Details
00:46 - Battlefield Fundamentals
01:20 - Class System Breakdown
01:43 - Assault Class
02:11 - Engineer Class
02:37 - Support Class
03:02 - Recon Class
03:28 - How BF6 Squads Work
04:00 - Revive Downed Squadmates
04:25 - Next-Level Destruction
05:03 - How Spotting Works in BF6
05:49 - Request Revive to Extend Bleedout
06:09 - Spot Enemies While Downed
06:24 - New Movement (Crouch Slide, Crouch Sprint)
06:44 - Use Supports Supply Bags Of
title: Battlefield 6: Essential Tips You Need to Succeed in the Second Beta Weekend

author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
PUBG Studios have announced that they are shutting down the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One versions of PUBG: Battlegrounds. Those last-gen consoles are more than 12 years old at this point, and the current-gen PS5 and Xbox Series X|S are well into the middle of their lifespans, so it's not entirely surprising. They did confirm that cosmetics and other items purchased and tied to a player's account will transfer to the current-gen versions of the game. In other news, inZoi, the hyper-realistic life sim aiming to dethrone EA's The Sims, will get a PS5 release sometime next year. The dev team also hasn't ruled out an Xbox Series X or S version, but no decision has been made on that port. And finally, we have an introduction to one of Borderlands 4's vault hunters—Harlowe the Gravitar.

Presented by Borderlands 4.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Another Major Game Is Ending PS4, Xbox One Support - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Car Park Capital announcement trailer for the upcoming satirical tycoon sim about paving the way for a brighter, oilier future. Car Park Capital will be available on PC.

In Car Park Capital, you are hired by Big Auto to reshape quiet towns into sprawling concrete kingdoms - one parking lot at a time. Using a potent mix of real-time strategy, urban development tools, and tongue-in-cheek propaganda, you will bulldoze houses, raise towering asphalt cathedrals, and convince citizens that life is better with more cars (and fewer opinions).

#IGN #Gaming
title: Car Park Capital - Official Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Look Pup! Fresh off his star-making performance in Superman, Krypto returns in a series of original comedic animated shorts. Produced by Warner Bros. Animation and DC Studios, Krypto Saves the Day! brings the caped canine's brand of heroic hijinks to everyday life in Metropolis. 

From school bus rescues to Spring Break cruise ship saves - and even Halloween candy crises - no adventure is too small as Krypto delivers super-powered action, laughs, and plenty of mischief for fans of all ages.

The first part of a 4-part series of animated shorts starring Krypto- Krypto Saves the Day!: School Buss Shuffle – will debut exclusively online starting Wednesday, August 13 prior to becoming available as a special feature on the Digital and physical release of Superman. 
Episode 2 - Krypto Saves the Day!: Halloween Havoc, Episode 3 - Krypto Saves the Day!: Package Pandemonium, and Part 4 - Krypto Saves the Day!: Coastal Catastrophe, will debut individually through 2026.

#IGN #Superman #DC
title: Krypto Saves the Day! - Official Clip (2025)

author: IGN
description:
Watch the Wuyang Gameplay Trailer for Overwatch 2, the legendary team-based action hero shooter developed by Blizzard Entertainment. Players can get acquainted with the new Hero being added to the game with Wuyang, a Hero fitted with water-based abilities. Wuyang is fitted with his powerful Xuanwu Staff for offensive tactics coupled with a mobility-focused arsenal, enabling him to provide healing support, apply pressure, and escape in a pinch at a moment's notice. Wuyang will be available for a limited time from August 14 through August 18 and will make his permanent debut in Season 18 for Overwatch 2.

#IGN #Gaming #Overwatch2

author: IGN
description:
Watch the trailer for Steve, an upcoming movie starring Cillian Murphy and Jay Lycurgo.

Set in the mid-90s, Steve is a reimagining of Max Porter's Sunday Times bestseller Shy. The film follows a pivotal day in the life of headteacher Steve (Academy Award winner Cillian Murphy) and his students at a last-chance reform school amidst a world that has forsaken them. As Steve fights to protect the school’s integrity and impending closure, we witness him grappling with his own mental health. In parallel to Steve’s struggles, we meet Shy (Jay Lycurgo), a troubled teen caught between his past and what lies ahead as he tries to reconcile his inner fragility with his impulse for self-destruction and violence.

Steve is produced by Alan Moloney, Cillian Murphy, and Tina Pawlik. Max Porter serves as executive producer. It is written by Max Porter. The music is by Ben Salisbury and Geoff Barrow.

Steve, directed by Tim Mielants, opens in select theaters on September 19, and on Netflix on October
title: Steve - Official Trailer (2025) Cillian Murphy, Jay Lycurgo

author: IGN
description:
After a brief appearance in Superman, the 11th Street Kids are back as Peacemaker returns for season 2. Christopher Smith, aka Peacemaker, has had a strange journey on his road to being a superhero. From his remarkable luck escaping certain death in Suicide Squad, to combating an alien invasion (albeit in the form of, frankly, adorable butterflies), to not joining the Justice League (or the Justice Gang) and his murderous, white supremacist father played by the T-1000 himself, catch up on everything you might've forgotten about Peacemaker and his time in the DCEU and with James Gunn in the new DCU.  How do they explain away that one pesky scene at the end of season 1? We'll find out soon enough!

#IGN #Peacemaker #DC
title: Peacemaker Season 1 Recap

author: IGN
description:
Watch seven minutes of footage from the new sword & sorcery film Red Sonja, starring Matilda Lutz, Robert Sheehan, Wallis Day, Martyn Ford, Michael Bisping, Phillip Winchester, and Trevor Eve.

Captured. Chained. Forced to fight for survival. Red Sonja must battle her way through the blood-soaked pits of a tyrant’s empire and rally an army of outcasts to reclaim her freedom and take down Dragan and his ruthless bride, Dark Annisia.

The film is produced by Les Weldon, Yariv Lerner, Luke Lieberman, Christa Campbell, Lati Grobman, Joe Gatta, MJ Basset, Jeffrey Greenstein, Avi Lerner, Mark Canton, P.G.A., Courtney Soloman, P.G.A, Jonathan Yunger. Executive producers on Red Sonja are Trevor Short, Darina Pavlova, Boaz Davidson, Tanner Mobley, Luke Lieberman, Dorothy Canton, Scott Karol, and Heidi Jo Markel. Red Sonja is written by Tasha Huo.

Red Sonja, directed by MJ Bassett, opens in theaters on August 15, 2025, and it releases digitally on August 29, 2025.

#IGN #Movies
title: Red Sonja: Exclusive Clip (2025) Matilda Lutz, Robert Sheehan

author: IGN
description:
Drag x Drive reviewed by Logan Plant on Nintendo Switch 2.

Drag x Drive controls like nothing else I’ve ever played, and it asks a lot of you in order to get used to its complicated mouse and motion mechanics. Obviously, if you don't like (or literally can’t use) forced motion controls like this, then you should steer clear. But once I put in the time to "get good," I really enjoyed the surprisingly deep fundamentals of Nintendo's unique take on wheelchair basketball. Its online three-on-three matches are a lot of fun, and it has some good ideas for provoking friendly competition between rounds that I wish were fleshed out a little bit more. That lack of substance is the most disappointing part about Drag x Drive, with little in the way of unlockables, customization, personality, and variety. I imagine a hardcore group of fans could rally around it, because its movement is very cool and there is a ton of potential to discover in its exciting trick system – but with a high initial bar
title: Drag x Drive Review
